title: 115_hr5270
content: The Act titled "Electricity Reliability and Fuel Security Act" provides a Federal Tax Credit for Coal-Powered Electric Generation Units under section 45T of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Federal Tax Credit for Coal-Powered Electric Generation Units, as outlined in the "Electricity Reliability and Fuel Security Act," allows taxpayers who own or lease such units to claim a credit equal to 30% of qualified expenses or $13 multiplied by the unit's capacity rating. Qualified expenses exclude coal-related costs, and the unit must use coal for at least 75% of electricity production. Public entities can transfer this credit. The Federal Tax Credit for Coal-Powered Electric Generation Units allows public entities to transfer the credit to eligible project partners, who will be treated as the taxpayer for the credit. The Federal Tax Credit for Coal-Powered Electric Generation Units allows public entities to transfer the credit to eligible project partners, who are responsible for operating, maintaining, or financing the coal-powered electric generation unit. The Federal Tax Credit for Coal-Powered Electric Generation Units allows public entities to transfer the credit to eligible project partners for the construction, operation, or leasing of such units. Special rules apply to partnerships, where the credit is determined at the partnership level, and the eligible project partner includes any partner of the partnership. The credit must be taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner after the public entity's taxable year. The Federal Tax Credit for Coal-Powered Electric Generation Units allows public entities to transfer the credit to eligible project partners. Special rules apply to partnerships, where the credit is determined at the partnership level. The credit must be taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner. The basis of the property is reduced by the amount of the credit allowed. This section applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017, and ending before January 1, 2023. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new clause for the credit determined under section 45T. Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new clause for the credit determined under section 45T for coal-powered electric generation units.
